result.execSummary:
The defendant Braderick S Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: CASH BOND OF $250.00 APPLIED, leaving a balance of $193.00.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.

-Domestic Abuse Assessment and any follow-up.
-No Violent contact with the victim.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Braderick S Jones

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Braderick S Jones
Current: 1406 16th St, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 03-29-2021)
Prior: 103 N. Wisconsin St Apt 200, Berlin, WI 54923 United States
Terminated Regular - 02/20/2019

9:37 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Kari Stockwell present in court via telephone.  Statement by defendant.  Statement by the Court.  Statement by defendant - can pay off today.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year, and if paid off before discharge, will discharge as scheduled.  If not paid off today, Court has no objection to probation discharging upon payment.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 9:40 a.m.

8:45 a.m.  Defendant not present in court.  Agent Kari Stockwell present in court via telephone.  Statement by Agent - talked with the defendant this morning and he stated he just got off the phone with the court and matter will be rescheduled to later in the week.  

Court adjourned at 8:46 a.m.
Call from defendant requesting to rescheduled his PRH scheduled for today due to the weather.  Advised defendant matter will be rescheduled and he will receive notice in the mail.
Probation review hearing on January 28, 2019 at 08:30 am.
of Expiration of State Public Defender Appointment

2:19 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - defendant will enter a plea to count one with no domestic enhancer with probation.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1, striking the domestic enhancer.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.
-Domestic Abuse Assessment and any follow-up.
-No Violent contact with the victim.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the court costs.

Court adjourned at 2:26 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 20, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

12:04 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - has received the standard motions.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - an agreement has been reached, but don't have a plea questionnaire completed.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on February 20, 2018 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 12:05 p.m.
